page.title: 09Landscape:Architecture.
page.content: Langwathby is built round a large village green. Edenhall is a linear village.Sandstone is the natural stone of the area. Some of the older houses have been protected from rain penetra- tion by pebble dash. The newer houses fit in very well if they are built with sandstone or manufactured stone and pebble dash. Very few new houses have the stone roof slates or Westmor- land slates. Concrete tiles are used now.The brown ones match the sandstone Some renovated houses have concrete lintels and sills but most buildings avoid this. The older council houses are built with brown bricks and have stone quoins. The newer council houses are pebble dash with stone porches. The school, which is in the more recently developed area ,is built with yellow bricks.The new development is keeping the character of the village.
